meanings.definition: To interrupt the quiet, rest, peace, or order of; unsettle
meanings.sent1: The loud noise outside can disturb my concentration while studying.
meanings.sent2: Please do not disturb the sleeping baby.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy loves to disturb the calm of the house by chasing its tail.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected news disturbed the tranquility of their vacation like a sudden storm.
meanings.sent5: The howling wind outside seemed to disturb the very walls of the old house.

meanings.sent1: I hope my phone doesn't disturb the meeting with its ringing.
meanings.sent2: The teacher asked the students not to disturb her while she was grading papers.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to disturb the birds by stealing their food.
meanings.sent4: The sudden power outage disturbed the flow of the presentation like a glitch in a video.
meanings.sent5: The loud construction noise could disturb the peace of the neighborhood for hours.

meanings.definition: To agitate or stir up; arouse from a state of rest
meanings.sent1: The loud music from the party next door can disturb our sleep.
meanings.sent2: Please do not disturb the settled dust on the shelves.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child loves to disturb the calm of the pond by throwing pebbles.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected arrival disturbed the routine of the household like a whirlwind.
meanings.sent5: The barking dog could disturb the peace of the park with its constant noise.
